title: C++ Level 7 â€” Functions & Recursion
concept: Define and use functions with parameters and return values, including recursive functions.

challenges.title: Distance Between Two Points
challenges.description: Write a function double distance(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2) that returns the distance between points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2). In main, read four doubles, call the function and print the result.
challenges.inputDescription: Four real numbers x1, y1, x2, y2.
challenges.outputDescription: One real number: distance between the two points.

challenges.title: Power Function (Iterative)
challenges.description: Write a function double power(double a, int n) that returns a^n for integer n (n can be negative, zero, or positive). Use a loop inside the function. In main, read a and n, call power and print the result.

challenges.title: Capitalize Words
challenges.description: Write a function void capitalize(string &s) that makes the first letter of each word uppercase. Words are separated by single spaces. In main, read a line into s, call capitalize, then print s.
challenges.outputDescription: Same sentence with each word capitalized.
examples:
Input:
hello world from c++

Output:
Hello World From C++

challenges.title: Recursive Power (Non-Negative n)
challenges.description: Write a recursive function double powerRec(double a, int n) to compute a^n for n >= 0. In main, read a and n, call powerRec, and print the result.

challenges.title: Recursive Fibonacci
challenges.description: Write a function long long fib(int n) that returns the n-th Fibonacci number using recursion. fib(0)=0, fib(1)=1. Assume n <= 30. In main, read n, print fib(n).

challenges.title: Reverse Sequence Recursively
challenges.description: Given a sequence of integers ending with 0, print all numbers (except the final 0) in reverse order using recursion and without using arrays.
challenges.inputDescription: Integers, one per line, ending with 0.
challenges.outputDescription: Same numbers in reverse order, each on its own line.

challenges.title: Iterative Fibonacci
challenges.description: Write a function long long fibIter(int n) that computes the n-th Fibonacci number using a loop. In main, read n and print fibIter(n).

challenges.title: Count Distinct (Function)
challenges.description: Write a function int countDistinct(const vector<int> &a) that returns the number of distinct integers in the vector. In main, read n, then n integers into a vector, call the function and print the result.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: n. Second line: n integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: number of distinct values.

challenges.title: Max of Array (Function)
challenges.description: Write a function int maxArray(const vector<int> &a) that returns the largest element. In main, read n, the elements, and print the maximum.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: n. Second line: n integers.

challenges.title: Contains Element (Function)
challenges.description: Write a function bool contains(const vector<int> &a, int x) that returns true if x appears in the vector. In main, read n, the elements, then x, and print YES if found, otherwise NO.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: n. Second line: n integers. Third line: x.
